abstract: South Korea’s National Pension Service, the country’s biggest investor, agreed to put up $1.29 billion for HSBC Holdings’ London headquarters.
snippet: South Korea’s National Pension Service, the country’s biggest investor, agreed to put up $1.29 billion for HSBC Holdings’ London headquarters.
lead_paragraph: South Korea’s National Pension Service, the country’s biggest investor, agreed to put up £772.5 million ($1.29 billion) for HSBC Holdings‘ London headquarters, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: HSBC Sells London H.Q. for $1.29 Billion
